com.jswiff.util
Class Base64

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.util.Base64
public class Base64
extends java.lang.Object

Class used for Base64 encoding and decoding. Based on Robert Harder's Base64 class, available as public domain software.

Method Summary
static byte[] decode(java.lang.String s)
          Decodes data from Base64 notation into a byte array.
static java.lang.String decodeString(java.lang.String s)
          Decodes data from Base64 notation and converts it to a string.
static short[] decodeUnsigned(java.lang.String s)
          Decodes data from Base64 notation into an unsigned byte array.
static java.lang.String encode(byte[] data)
          Encodes a byte array into Base64 notation.
static java.lang.String encodeString(java.lang.String string)
          Encodes a string to a sequence of bytes using UTF-8 as encoding, then encodes the byte sequence into Base64 notation.
static java.lang.String encodeUnsigned(short[] data)
          Encodes an array of unsigned bytes into Base64 notation.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

decode

public static byte[] decode(java.lang.String s)
Decodes data from Base64 notation into a byte array.

Parameters:
s - the Base64 string to decode
Returns:
the decoded data

decodeString

public static java.lang.String decodeString(java.lang.String s)
Decodes data from Base64 notation and converts it to a string. UTF-8 is used as encoding.

Parameters:
s - the Base64 string to decode
Returns:
the decoded string

decodeUnsigned

public static short[] decodeUnsigned(java.lang.String s)
Decodes data from Base64 notation into an unsigned byte array. As Java doesn't support unsigned bytes as data types, they are stored as short values.

Parameters:
s - the Base64 string to decode
Returns:
the decoded data

encode

public static java.lang.String encode(byte[] data)
Encodes a byte array into Base64 notation.

Parameters:
data - The data to convert
Returns:
Base64 encoded string

encodeString

public static java.lang.String encodeString(java.lang.String string)
Encodes a string to a sequence of bytes using UTF-8 as encoding, then encodes the byte sequence into Base64 notation. This is especially useful for strings containing illegal characters with respect to the XML spec.

Parameters:
string - string to be encoded
Returns:
Base64 encoded string

encodeUnsigned

public static java.lang.String encodeUnsigned(short[] data)
Encodes an array of unsigned bytes into Base64 notation. As Java doesn't support unsigned bytes, these are stored as short values.

Parameters:
data - array of unsigned bytes as short array
Returns:
Base64 encoded string
